lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Ancr nrpq kI pCwnYN BwKw bolq bcn iKn bUJ ibn dyK hI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Anachar Narapat Kee Pachhaanain Bhaakhaa , Bolat Bachan Khin Boojh Bin Daykh Hee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an attendant on king waits behind him and recognises his sound and utterances without even seeing the king.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jOhrI prK jwnq hY rqn kI dyKq hI khY KrO Koto rUp ryK hI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jauharee Parakh Jaanat Hai Ratan Kee , Daykhat Hee Kahai Kharau Khoto Roop Raykh Hee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a gemologist knows the art of evaluating the precious stones and is able to declare whether a stone is fake or genuine by a look on its form.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy KIr nIr ko inbyro kir jwnY hMs rwKIAY imlwie iBMn iBMn kY sryK hI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kheer Neer Ko Nibayro Kari Jaanai Hansa , Raakheeai Milaai Bhinn Bhinn Kai Saraykh Hee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a swan knows how to separate milk and water and is able to do in no time.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur sbd sunq pihcwnY isK Awn bwnI kiRqmI n gnq hY lyK hI ]570]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Sabad Sounat Pahichaanai Sikha , Aan Baanee Kritamee N Ganat Hai Laykh Hee ?570?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a true Sikh of the True Guru recognises which composition is fake and which one is genuine, created by the True Guru as soon as he hears it. He discards what is not genuine in no time and keeps it in no account.  (570)
